Reviews.Content: Showlet Dear future Florence tourists. As an American group we went to Firenze a few months ago with a group through Explorica... Being high school students these things can get a tad expensive so we were booked at the Cordova and were utterly shocked by our rooms. The beds weren't exactly well kept, the televisions did not work, no shampoo, etc. The towels were like Brillo pads and to say the least we discovered a new form of bathroom use. The showlet A shower and a toilet in one. I suppose the owners didn't believe in using a bit of the space they had wisely so they made a drain in the middle of the room, put a shower head almost right about the toilet, and through a curtain over both.. How CREATIVE! Sense the sarcasm. Overall, we survived and the breakfast was good for those of us who were dieting. cafe was excellent and Florence was beautiful. I can only say that Hotel Cordova struck a chord with us in more than one way. Here is a song the group wrote while we were bored one night. To the tune of hotel california by the eagles. Just for your entertainement.. :)Hotel CordovaExplorica B vs NJ GroupLFARM Records 4/ 2008Welcome to the Hotel Cordova What a lovely place (echo)Just kidding it's a wasteShowering at the Hotel CordovaUnder the showlet (echo) Using the toilette Living it up at the Hotel CordovaIn room fourrr ten (echo)We can eat our breadFlorence is so beautiful and gorgeousToo bad it's a shame (echo)We are a royal pain Poor guy at the counter we drove him crazyAsking for our keys (echo)Just give'm to meeee!Anyways thats the hotel cordovaWhat else is to be said (echo)Just try to go to bed Living it up at the Hotel Cordova What a lovely place (echo)Just kidding it's a waste----Not to be copied... Not without MY consent.. haha. Let me know what you think!
Reviews.Author: travelingwithmypants

Reviews.Content: Don't stay if you don't have to! Being a two star hotel I wasn't going to be be expecting anything too luxurious but nothing prepared me for what was waiting in our room. The only positive things I can really say about this hotel is that we had a very spacious balcony and it was not a far walk to Firenze attractions. Though there was no shampoos, soaps or wash cloths and the shower suceeded in making the whole bathroom drenched. The towels smelled of vinegar and though we were provided with a fan, it was non functional. When me and my room mates asked for a new fan they disreguarded our request. Even with these minor complaints I was willing to stay in the room with optimistic views. It was only when we returned from dinner to find our room infested with cockroaches that gave us a scare. When we went to tell the man at the main desk we laughed in our faces and told us that they have never had a cockroach problem before and do not understand what our fuss is. I STRONGLY advise booking a different hotel!
Reviews.Author: bayemmpay

Reviews.Content: Amazing location I stayed in this hotel on an Explorica Educational Tour (www.explorica.com) the second week of July. I am an employee of Explorica (an educational tour company) and was accompanying a tour to Rome, Florence and Venice. The hotel was great and had an amazing rooftop patio with a view of the Duomo. It was a great location and the group loved the area and the city. I can't wait to go back!-Kurt
Reviews.Author: RFV4life

Reviews.Content: Ugh!       Dizzying view from the balcony
Reviews.Author: chinaski7628

Reviews.Content: Saved by the staffs! We ended in Hotel Cordova because we took one look at the rooms of the hotel recommended and gave it a pass.We were greeted at the front desk by Carmello, an extremely helpful, friendly staff. He showed us the rooms and communicated in english which was a plus, considering its the only thing we speak. Initially we had decided to stay for a night but when we told him we were hunting for a better place, he took the trouble to run us through the city sights and recommended other places, it was like having a walkthrough of all the things to see in Florence, without actually paying for a guide. That made us change our mind and we decided to stick with the hotel for the 3 days we were here.In the evenings, we were accompanied by the evening staff, Simone. He too made our stay even more enjoyable by chatting us up (since there is only one english channel, CNN -it gets tiring after a while). He spoke perfect english from the stint in Canada and don't be fooled by the look of seriousness, he CAN make you laugh.All in all, the rooms are clean and well kept, the toilets are large with a TV. The breakfast has the variety we havent had in any of our other stays, it includes a choice of oats, biscotti, cornflakes, paninis, milk, juice, coffee...pretty sumptous considering we only had a bun, biscotti and coffee in the other hotels we stayed at, for the price. We paid about 60 Euros a night for the 3 night stay.Location is good. The place is quiet and very near the train station, about 10 mins walk. If you get tired, you can always go down the the road in front of the hotel and take any bus to the train station. Coming back from the train station you can take the bus 25 and drop near the Piaza Liberta and take a 3 mins walk back. You don't have to walk all over Florence, Hop on the bus and see where it takes you, it's kinda fun, and they ALWAYS end up back in the train station, or so we reckon, but ask the hotel staff, thats how we found out.We'd definately stay at Hotel Cordova again if we visit Florence in the future. Only because of the excellent staff, if not, you pretty much can get the same thing elsewhere in Florence.
Reviews.Author: Lavascoop

Reviews.Content: Not bad, but could do better for same price We actually booked at a different hotel, but due to a computer glitch where our original place got OVERbooked, we and a few other people got shuffled off to other hotels that still had rooms available on this holiday weekend. Hotel Cordova became our site.The room size was reasonable and the room was clean. The mattress was good. We had a balcony that overlooked a fairly quiet street (because it was a fair distant from the main city attractions, albeit still within walking distance). This was a nice feature, but oddly enough, we had to climb out a window to get to it (we could tell other rooms actually had doors to their balconies). The room was quiet despite the hotel being filled with fairly large numbers of high school (?) travel groups. There were a number of negatives though that would prevent me from going back there. First, we had what I call a shoilet. This is a combo shower toilet area. Picture a shower space with a toilet in it! When taking a shower, you close the lid to the toilet and cover the toilet paper roll to minimze wetness. Or, as my husband pointed out, you can kill two birds with one stone! The towels, as noted in a different review, were the same material and thickness as sheets. The breakfast consisted of corn flakes and dinner rolls. Finally, the hotel starts on the 3rd level. While there is a one-person elevator, it lets you off half way between floors so you have to drag your luggage up a set of stairs. While the staff did speak English and were not rude, they also didn't extend any warmth or help.I didn't get to see the rooms of the hotel that we originally booked but based upon the lobby and reviews on this site, it appeared much better than this hotel and was for the same price.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Pretty Cool I stayed at the Cordova on a school trip. It was really nice, clean, and the room was faitly large.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great hotel offering value for money It took us around 10 mins walk from the train station and where greeted with a very warm welcome. The rooms are basic though offer excellent value for money and ours had a good air con system,television, breakfast included. The staff are friendly and always willing to help and the hotel is only a few minutes from the Domo. Well recommended.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Florence We had an good 3 night stay. The Cordova is close to all of the major sights. We found good places to eat close by. The breakfast was good, room clean, staff helpful and friendly, they made reservations for us ahead of time for the Accademia and the Uffizi.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't book here if you can get out of it I stayed here for 3 nights in mid August 2005. Just got back, in fact. I booked this hotel through a travel agency b/c it was inexpensive (like $60 US dollars per night?) and I was trying to work with in a budget. I went and checked online after I booked and paid, and saw these reviews and got a little concerned but tried to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt- mainly because I really didn't have much time to try and change the booking. I wish I found the time to change it (and was kicking myself in Florence) because the hotel was about 1 mile from the historic area (the main area with all the history. I live in NYC and I am used to walking everywhere but after walking around Florence all day, that trek back to the hotel is really annoying, especially if you want to go back to your hotel mid/late-day at some point to drop off bags, get ready for dinner, etc.. So, basically, to walk back and forth to the hotel twice a day (morning, late day, and night) actually adds another 4 miles to your day of already about 10 miles of just walking around. Plus, its not a pretty walk. As far as the accomadations - they are bare-boned. The rooms was an ok size and the view was of an alley of some kind - nothing spectacular. The air conditioning didn't work (but it wasn't too hot with the window open). The walls were thin - but not too much noise on the 5th floor, the breakfast hours were 7:30-9am but I didn't bother to go. The bathrooms provided no shampoo and just a tiny bar of soap - no wash cloth. The shower was not great but did the job and I always had a tiny trickle of hot water. Towels were like sheets and smelled like vinager. The people at the front desk were polite and spoke english, but didn't extend themselves (nobody to help with bags, no recommendations on things to do). However, they did give a timely wake up call for 2 of the nights I was there. Also, they lock the front door (street entrance) after midnight so you have to buzz in. The elevator was tiny but worked. All in all- I would never go back or recommend it to anyone because there must be a better hotel in a better location for the same price. If you have to stay here- try to book online tickets to the Accademia to see the David for an early morning time and at least you can take advantage of the hotel's proxemity to the David - its only benefit.Ciao!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not that gud I have just came bac from a 4 night stay and i found the hotel quite ok. but the breakfast was not gud , they rooms did not luk lyk wat they was on the pics on the hotel site also, it smelt lyk sewage around the hotel back , (courtyard) Also the lift broken and was not gud wen getting ur suitcases upstairs. Overall it was ok but i wud neva want to go there eva agen.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fine for a Two-Star As the Cordova is only a two-star, it's unreasonable to expect too much from it. On the up-side, it's clean and our room was a decent size. It's not too much of a walk into town (10 mins) and close to the Accademia.On the down side, it's above some funny looking apartments, and our toilet was a dodgy flusher. It was maybe a little overpriced at 拢60 a night in high summer.Not bad, overall. We probably won't stay here again, but do not regret the experience at all.
Reviews.Author: OverworkedMedStudent

Reviews.Content: It could be worst.... Me and my wife were expecting worst about the Cordova Hotel. It is a two star hotel and the only 1/4 of the staff speaks english. The other part speaks only Italian. The breakfast (continental) isn麓t so bad, and the waiters are very kindly. The room we stayed has a double bed and a bathroom. There was a TV, but no bar. I think the best feature of this hotel is your location, in the outskirts of the ancient town. It takes a 10 minute walk from the Hotel to the Piazza del Duomo, where from there you can reach all the other famous historical places. Furthermore, the hotel is a 15 minutes walk from the raisl station S. Maria Novela.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Spartan, Soulless. Serviceable If you are reading this and have already booked - dont worry it's ok (very, very basic..if you like an early moring cuppa...take a kettle  cups).If you haven't yet booked, consider something else if you value any creature comforts !!We had a deranged insomniac above us who insisted on re-arranging what sparse furniture there was around (mainly at 2am ). The soundproofing could be better.The air conditioning does work well...if you can tolerate having to continually request that it be switched on (a cost-cutting initiative gone wrong).There must be better hotels in Florence for the same money.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Relatively OK We arrived at this hotel after a few days at the Antigo Trovatore in Venice which looked pretty ropey but was actually fine. The Cordova also looks quite ropey from the outside - the entrance hall (shared with apartments) is not very welcoming and the lift rather creaky, but we found the staff very helpful. The rooms are pretty basic with the strange toilet/shower arrangement that others have noted; the breakfast was adequate but no more than that. All-in-all, not a bad base for operations in Florence. Be warned: the walk to the Duomo is about 15 mins in the morning, but after a strenuous days walking it feels more like an hour!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Criticisms are unjustified I have just returned from a 3night stay in Cordova. Before leaving I read these reviews and panicked! Felt so strongly on returning that had to put own experience forward. We were staying at hotel during peak season but heard NO noise at all whilst in room, AC kept room at lovely temp, shower/toilet combo caused no problem - so what if the toilet gets a bit splashed?!? We were provided with linen towels in every city we stayed in Italy. They did the job. Breakfast enjoyable in light, airy breakfast room. The staff were friendly and attentive. Think other reviewwriters must be used to staying in 5star hotels. Hotel was spotlessly clean and more than adequately fulfilled its purpose. It is also located close to the city centre. You would have to be REALLY lazy to complain about a 20 minute walk into the centre of Florence. We were also able to walk to train station with suitcases. For a basic hotel we really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay again. I have passed address on to friends.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Cud have been worse I must say reading the other reviews before this trip scared me a little. The bathroom set up is pretty bizarre, the toilet is situated in front of the shower  when u pull the shower curtain across u r indeed sharing ur shower with the toilet. It's a wet room kind of thing, which means everything ends up soaked when u have a shower. I advise havin a shower late at night or very early in the mornin because it turns into a cold trickle in times of demand. The towels are terrible, I strongly advice u bring ur own. The rooms are quite clean but only some are supplied with air conditioning. However all are supplied with mosquito killers and TVs but they dnt have english channels. Breakfast wasn't anything special, Italian rolls which are flavourless or vile lookin cereal, the orange juice isnt 2 good either and the hot chocolate is only bearable with lots of sugar. There is a McDonalds nearby tho, along with many ither resturants. I dont think any of the views are anything special, one side of the hotel is on a noisy road but over looks a bit of florence and the other side which is quieter and has balconies over looks another hotel. There is a fair bit of walkin 2 get 2 any of the local attractions. It definitely deserves its 2 star rating, its a bearable stay, it cud be a lot worse.
Reviews.Author: itsallaboutbob

Reviews.Content: I don't see what everyone's problem is! Okay, so this hotel is basic, but what exactly are you expecting from a 2 star hotel? You're not going to get warm fluffy towels and a huge bathroom, leave that to the expensive places. This hotel is very clean, and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are of a good size, most with great views! Yes, the shower is literally ON the toilet, but if you're careful it really doesn't present any problem at all, and when I stayed there, I didn't notice any funny smells, or encounter any problems with water pressure/temperature. Lastly, this hotel is in a fantastic location. A 10 minute walk to the city centre where you can get to everything. Obviously if you're lazy, I suppose this could present a problem to you, in which case I recommend you stay in one of the 5 star luxury hotels right in the centre. All in all, I would definitely stay here again, after all, a hotel is just for sleeping in when everything's shut, and the beds are very comfortable.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel Crapova...... Hotel is located on the outskirts of the main city limits. Not convenient for walking around town. The room was freezing and the lack of heat made the colds days/nights interesting. The bathroom was okay if you don't mind showering where you....... Walls are extremely thin, allowing you to feel included in the many tour groups that seem to stay here. The breakfast consisted of stale rolls, watery OJ and really WEAK coffee even by American standards. Most of the staff was friendly.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Better than I expected... We've just returned from our class trip and I must admit, before I left, I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews. First, let me address the shower issue. Which really isn't an issue. It's a tiled area with a shower curtain and a drain in the floor. It appears to be the norm in that region. Infact, my bathroom in Venice did not even have a curtain. (that was a resort hotel) But I would suggest your own towels and a pair of shower shoes (which you ought to have anyway). The area that the hotel is situated is gorgeous and since there is SO much to see, you won't be in your room for anytime longer than what you need to sleep and shower. Yes, the rolls are hard. It seems that's how they are, crusty outside and soft inside. At least that is what I found throughout the country. The cappuccino is tremendous though. The juice was better than I've had at other hotels. The staff was incredible. Mind you we were a group of 50+ people mostly middle school kids. I had a clean and relatively quiet room. The only sound I heard was the street but that is my own doing. After hours of touring the city and staying out late in the disco, I was to lazy to close up the shutters. I unfortunately did not have a room with a balcony. And like I said before the staff was great. They were friendly and extremely attentive. I would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Slightly odd, but fulfilled it's purpose This hotel was OK. we only really spent evenings here, which was good, because although it wasn't bad, it wasnt especially amazing either! The room was nice, clean and comfortable - especially after we decorated it with our own posters (the cleaning staff didn't seem to mind this). The main problem was the bathroom, because there was a lingering smell of something remarkably like sewage. Also the shower is slightly worrying, situated practically over the toilet, and more often than not a scalding/freezing dribble! we had a nice balcony and the staff were really nice. The breakfasts are adequate and they don't serve dinner, so you have to find somewhere else to eat in the evenings. fortunatly there is a mcdonalds about 5 mins down the street! We went there on a school trip, and it was fine for me and my friends (although the walls are pretty thin, so if there are things you dont want anyone to know, dont be too loud!!!!). I would advise you to take your own towels as well.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not bad... The Hotel Cordova is located in Via Cavour, Florence, about a 10 minute walk to the Duomo and city centre. The room I stayed in was fairly spacious with a balcony and en-suite bathroom. In the bathroom the shower was over the toilet and there was a constant smell of sewage looming that didn't go away. The shower didn't have any sort of basin underneath it so, although there was a shower curtain, the bathroom was drenched throughout after you took a shower. The towels provided were more like dish cloths/linen so it's a necessity to bring your own towels if you visit this hotel. The room was adequately equipped with a satellite tv, air conditioning, clean bed linen, and quite comfortable beds. Breakfast in this hotel isn't at all wonderful. A buffet with a choice of bread rolls (on some days stale) with a variety of jams/butter/chocolate spread, cornflakes, and tea/coffee/hot chocolate is what is on offer. Other features to this hotel are very friendly staff, a lift (although small), and a bar. Overall this hotel isn't bad if you aren't planning to spend much time in it. The bad points are balanced out with the good points so it's a good place to stay if you are a school group (like I did).
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: bizarre but nice i stayed in this hotel for a week, and it really wasnt as bad as the other reviews are trying to make out! the people were really lovely, there was a nice american door man with a fit *** (always a bonus). admittedly, the shower arrangement was a little bit odd with it right over the toilet, and most days it was less a shower, more a scalding hot dribble, but the beds were really comfortable, the place was clean and it had balconies! the breakfast wasnt too bad, the rolls were a little on the stale side but they were nice warm, and the hot chocolate was fine once you added a lot of sugar. at least the place had a lift! it's near to the city centre and lots of food places, i think its a great hotel for 2 stars, you could get a lot worse.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: It was a place to crash at night... We just returned from there with a school tour. We didn't spend enough time in our rooms to really hate the place. The first night we were there, we had the priviledge of hearing our guide (across the hall from us) arguing with the hotel management about the heat and water. That itself was an interesting insight into the Italian life. Yes, the toilet is in the shower, but the balcony was wonderful. It was quite clean, and we didn't bring home any little visitors. They apparently wash their towels with white vinegar. Now when I smell white vinegar, I will always remember our funny little hotel in Florence and the wonderful time we had there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Whats the Problem? I went to Hotel Cordova with my school on a trip and although it wasn't what we were used to, it wasn't that bad. There are four people to a room and there is a bathroom for each room. The rooms were either hot in the day or damp at night as the heating didn't work and neither did the a/c. I agree that the walls were thin and the breakfast wasn't up to much, but we didn't catch anything!! The people that run the hotel are very friendly, and they are there every morning with a smile on their faces walking round with the coffee jug or hot chocolate, asking if we would like any. The TV room is next to the reception where we watched a football match and relaxed one night. The hotel isn't a bad walk in to the town, you just stay on the Via Cavour and you get to the duomo (cathedral). Just down the street is a nice cafe and opposite is a sports bar. You have to realise that the hotel is a 2-Star, and your not going to get a luxurious hotel but they are really nice people and isn't over-run with rodents and pests and is perfectly clean. In Florence, be careful if you are wearing backpacks, and always keep your hands in your pockets as there are several pick-pockets as one of the girls on our trip has an ATTEMPTED theft. Also, there are several beggers in the town but are really nice if you don't wish to give them any money. So, give it a go, and if your hungery at all, there are several food places, and a McDonalds near by!! ; )
Reviews.Author: TheBFG5

Reviews.Content: You must be joking.. Stayed here for a week. Dont have the breakfast unless you like watery orange juice, weak coffee and stale buns with mini packs of sliglty strange coloured chocolate spread. Rooms are average with some good views over florence, and the noisy street below. can here other rooms through thin walls. bathroom cramped with shower above toilet - an interesting experiance. water gets is cold after 7:45 so if your looking for a nice hot shower you should get up early. also the pressure and temperature of the shower is variable. otherwise what a great place to stay. to be fair the owners and staff are very friendly and talkative if your into italian football.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice toilet/shower combo!! Stayed here over a year ago, but still remember the Cordova clearly! The towels provided were more like bed linen, so it was just as well I brought my own! Also, the bathroom, which was very small and had no ventilation, had the toilet in the shower because of the lack of space. The hotel's saving grace was the lovely balcony we had in our room, it had a lovely view right over the city.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: What a dump TheHotel Cordava (via cavour)... was a massive dissapointment. Yep, its only a 2 star... and if you had a better room its would probably be ok. Make sure you are not put on the same floor as reception (i.e. level/piano 3).The room was a good size and the sheets were clean. The bathroom featre combine toilet, bidae, and shower and was dirty and old. It also had a lingering sewage smell.We were inlucky and encountered a teenager night receprion staff that decide to have a party while we were there. They have a tv room also, with the tc so loud that you can here it through the walls.Location wise, the hotel is a half hour walk from the station and is out of the city centre to the extent that the area it dead at night. The street is also a main thorough fare which causes alot of traffic noise at night.Don't stay here....
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
